thesises.common names: req or request, can be any valid JS identifier
thesises.origination: out of http.IncommingMessage it is the instance of nodejs core object

subjects.req.params: array. contains the named route parameters
subjects.req.param(name): returns named route parameter, or GET/POST params. RECOMMEND TO AVOID!
subjects.req.query: contains querystring params as name/value pairs aka GET params
subjects.req.body: contains POST params. To parse the body content need use middleware
subjects.req.route: contains currently matched route. Uses mainly for debugging
subjects.req.cookies/req.signedCookies: object. contains cookie passed from the client
subjects.req.accepts[types]: method. to determine whether the client accepts given type(s)
subjects.req.host: method. get the client's hostname. !!!Should not be used for security purposes!!!
subjects.req.xhr: property. true if origignates for AJAX
subjects.req.secure: property. true if connetcions is secure
subjects.req.url/req.originalUrl: properties. returns path and quesrystring. originalUrl returns the original request
subjects.req.acceptLanguages: method. returns array of preferred languages. Comes from request header

thesises.common names: res, resp or response, can be any valid JS identifier
thesises.origination: out of http.ServerResponse it is the instance of nodejs core object

subjects.res.status(code): sets HTTP status code. Default 200(OK). 404(Not Found), 500(Server Error) or any other should be specified. Not suitable for redirect status codes (30X)
subjects.res.redirect([status], url): redirects the browser. Default 302(Found). Other redirect codes should be specified
subjects.res.send(body), res.send(status, body): sends a response body with optional statuse code. Default content-type is text/html. If needs change content-type, before sending of body the header should be changed appropriately by using res.set() method
subjects.res.json(json), res.json(status, json): sends JSON. Status code is optional
subjects.res.jsonp(jsonp), res.jsonp(status, json: sends JSONP. Status code is optional
subjects.res.type(type): sets the Content-Type header. Allow easelly sets a content type. F.e. res.type('text') will set header Content-Type: text/plain. Explicit setting is better!
subjects.res.format(object): allows send different content depending on the Accept request header. F.i. res.format({'text/plain': 'hi there', 'text/html': 'hi there'})
subjects.res.attachment([filename]), res.download: set a response header called Content-Disposition to attachment. It is a way to say to a browser to download the content instead render it on a display. res.download - specify a file, res.attachment - sets the header
subjects.res.sendFile(path, [options], [callback]: will read a file specified by path and send it content to the client
subjects.res.links(links): sets the Links response header. Little use
subjects.res.locals, res.render(view, [locals], c: res.locals - object - contains default context for rendering views. res.render - renders view using the configured template engine. res.render don't set status code 200. It shoul be done manually by using res.status(code)
